content:
This is the current UI, in different states, for the new "Send a poll" modal being introduced in #22370. Would appreciate any thoughts on all the labels / placeholder texts / any other strings. Do these current ones seem fine? Would love to hear any alternatives you may have in mind
The modal picks up any pm recipients from the compose box

When the compose box is in pm mode but has no pm recipients

The modal picks up the stream and topic names from the compose box

When the compose box is in stream mode but has no stream specified
Related thread: #design > poll terminology (FYI Alya Abbott)

A couple of options (hah) I was pondering:

  1. Would "Add a question" be better than "Add question"?
  2. Should it be "Add (an) option" rather than "New option" to match the question field better?
Also, would it be helpful to have more elaborate labels (or explanations underneath the labels) for the fields, or are "Question" and "Options" clear enough?

Alya Abbott said:

A couple of options (hah) I was pondering:

  1. Would "Add a question" be better than "Add question"?
  2. Should it be "Add (an) option" rather than "New option" to match the question field better?

Hmm, I'm thinking maybe we should reserve phrases with action words (here "add") for the buttons which actually execute those actions. That's how the current editing UI for polls and todo widgets is. Maybe a placeholder like "Your question" would be better for the questions field :thinking:
A distinction between placeholder and button text would be especially helpful for the poll editing UI where they are right next to each other
Just bumping this up since it's been a while
Should we add hint text for the topic name in the case when no topic is specified? Just "Topic" seems fine there.
Can we make the stream selector be left-aligned with the text above when no stream is selected? It's currently aligned only once a stream is chosen.

Alya Abbott When the stream selector is empty there actually is the empty colorblock on it's left as usual, but it's outline is hardly visible in dark mode. Here's what it looks like in light mode:
image.png

I believe the right fix would be making the colorblock outline more prominent (and basically the same color as the rest of the stream selector's outline, as expected) in the dark mode

Here's what the colorblock looks like in dark mode after fixing it's box-shadow:
image.png

Ignore the "Title" placeholder in the topic field, have corrected it to "Topic" now:
image.png
Sure, that looks reasonable to me. (It's something of an edge case, since usually there will already be a stream selected when the modal is opened.) Thanks!
